item.title: The Knights of Programming Paradigms
item.description: Currently Reading: Site Reliability Engineering, Clean Architecture In my current struggle to learn programming, I’m trying to learn the different paradigms of programming there are. So far, we have: Structured Programming, Object Orientated Programming, Functional Programming, Procedural Programing. Let’s start from the top: Structured Programming “The art of programming is the art of organizing complexity, of mastering multitude and avoiding its bastard chaos as effectively as possible.“ - Edsger Dijkstra Edsger Wybe Dijkstra was a programmer in the 1950s from the Netherlands.

item.title: Love Bites (Cont.)
item.description: Currently Reading: The Art of Computer Programming, Volume 4, Fascicle 1: Bitwise Tricks & Techniques; Binary Decision Diagrams Continuing off of yesterday’s blog post of Love Bit(e)s, now with the basis of binary arithmetic it’s a lot easier to understand bitwise operations! What is a Bitwise Operator, and why do I care? A bitwise operation manipulates bits for calculations or comparisons. They are insanely fast and efficient. Harvard Mark I

Talks Feel free to reach out via e-mail if you think I would be a good speaker for a convention! Dockercon EU 2018 Title: Wisdom From the OpsFathers with Sarah Christoff and Moustapha Gueye Abstract: Distributed infrastructure is necessary with the growing demands in our everyday applications. But with distributed infrastructure comes distributed problems, and the additional complexity these systems add onto our systems teams make them pull their hair out.

Some-Type-A Systems Engineer You can find me running through the convention center halls, or hidden in the back corners of a coffee shop piled under empty cups. This blog’s purpose is meant to aide me in the creation of talks, understanding and investigating the subject matter, and general exploration. If there’s anything you’d love to see here, let me know!
